abstract: An object that controls operations that generate Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) code, Portable Document Format (PDF) code, or print jobs.
overview:
## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] object works in conjunction with two other objects: an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] object, which specifies how the code should be generated, and an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView] object, which generates the actual code.

It is important to note that the majority of methods in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] copy the instance of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] passed into them. Future changes to that print info are not reflected in the print info retained by the current [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] object. All changes should be made to the print info before passing to the methods of this class. The only method in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] which does not copy the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] instance is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation/printInfo].

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsprintoperation
crawled: 2025-12-07T23:35:26Z
---

# NSPrintOperation

**Class**

An object that controls operations that generate Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) code, Portable Document Format (PDF) code, or print jobs.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class NSPrintOperation
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] object works in conjunction with two other objects: an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] object, which specifies how the code should be generated, and an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView] object, which generates the actual code.

It is important to note that the majority of methods in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] copy the instance of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] passed into them. Future changes to that print info are not reflected in the print info retained by the current [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] object. All changes should be made to the print info before passing to the methods of this class. The only method in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation] which does not copy the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintInfo] instance is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPrintOperation/printInfo].



## Creating the Printing Operation Object

- **epsOperation(with:inside:to:)**: Creates and returns a new print operation object ready to control the copying of EPS graphics from the specified view.
- **epsOperation(with:inside:to:printInfo:)**: Creates and returns a new print operation object ready to control the copying of EPS graphics from the specified view using the specified print settings.
- **epsOperation(with:inside:toPath:printInfo:)**: Creates and returns a new print operation object ready to control the copying of EPS graphics from the specified view and write the resulting data to the specified file.
- **pdfOperation(with:inside:to:)**: Creates and returns a new print operation object ready to control the copying of PDF graphics from the specified view.
- **pdfOperation(with:inside:to:printInfo:)**: Creates and returns a new print operation object ready to control the copying of PDF graphics from the specified view using the specified print settings.
- **pdfOperation(with:inside:toPath:printInfo:)**: Creates and returns a new print operation object ready to control the copying of PDF graphics from the specified view and write the resulting data to the specified file.
- **init(view:)**: Creates and returns an print operation object ready to control the printing of the specified view.
- **init(view:printInfo:)**: Creates and returns an print operation object ready to control the printing of the specified view using custom print settings.

## Setting the Current Print Operation for This Thread

- **current**: The current print operation for this thread.

## Determining the Type of Operation

- **isCopyingOperation**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the print operation is an EPS or PDF copy operation.

## Modifying the Printing Information

- **printInfo**: The printing information associated with the print operation.
- **NSPrintInfo**: An object that stores information that’s used to generate printed output.

## Getting the View

- **view**: The view object that generates the actual data for the print operation.

## Getting the Printing Quality

- **preferredRenderingQuality**: The printing quality.
- **NSPrintOperation.RenderingQuality**: Constants that specify the print quality in use.

## Running the Print Operation

- **run()**: Runs the print operation on the current thread.
- **runModal(for:delegate:didRun:contextInfo:)**: Runs the print operation, calling your custom delegate method upon completion.
- **cleanUp()**: Called at the end of a print operation to remove the print operation as the current operation.
- **deliverResult()**: Delivers the results of the print operation to the intended destination.

## Modifying the User Interface

- **showsPrintPanel**: A Boolean value that determines whether the print operation displays a print panel.
- **showsProgressPanel**: A Boolean value that determines whether the print operation displays a progress panel.
- **jobTitle**: The custom title of the print job.
- **printPanel**: The print panel object to use during the operation.
- **pdfPanel**: The PDF panel object to use during the operation.

## Managing the Drawing Context

- **context**: The graphics context object used for generating output.
- **createContext()**: Creates the graphics context object used for drawing during the operation.
- **destroyContext()**: Destroys the print operation’s graphics context.

## Managing Page Information

- **currentPage**: The current page number being printed.
- **pageRange**: The range of pages associated with the print operation.
- **pageOrder**: The print order for the pages of the operation.
- **NSPrintOperation.PageOrder**: Constants that specify the page order.

## Managing Printing Threads

- **canSpawnSeparateThread**: A Boolean value that determines whether the print operation is allowed to spawn a separate printing thread.

## Print Information

- **NSPrinter**: An object that describes a printer’s capabilities.
- **NSPrintInfo**: An object that stores information that’s used to generate printed output.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
